subsc:
General transportation sector,Central government administration,General water, sanitation and flood
            protection sector
trustfund: TF028639-GET-PPA ECUADOR BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION,TF028700-GET-BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is rated
            moderately unsatisfactory because although its objectives
            were relevant and fit well with the environmental priorities
            of the country, the project had only modest success in
            changing the most important institutional, legal, and social
            impediments to sound biodiversity management in Ecuador.
            Sustainability is rated unlikely because the project largely
            failed to build the institutional support, stakeholder
            ownership, and social support needed to ensure
            sustainability of project accomplishments. Institutional
            development impact is rated modest. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are rated unsatisfactory. Three
            lessons learned were: 1) The promotion of biodiversity
            protection needs to take the political dimension into
            account and plan and provide for building alliances in
            support of needed reforms of the system. Lacking internal
            and external support, many of the studies, recommendations,
            and proposals produced by the project did not result in
            action by the implementing agency. 2) Realistic objectives,
            clear benchmarks, and sound monitoring are crucial to ensure
            that project activities contribute to strategic goals. 3)
            Excessive complexity was one of the project's major
            flaws. To make it manageable, projects should address a few
            crucial factors and seek to gradually build capacity.
